page.title: 06THE POUND COIN.
page.content: We asked people in Leamington what they thought about the new pound coin introduced in January 1985 to replace the one pound note. There had been many complaints in the press, but in the survey we found that 28 out of 54 people said they liked it, 18 did not like it and 8 were non-commital. From what the newspapers had said, we expected to find a huge majority of people opposed to the new coin but in fact we found that over 50% of those we asked were quite happy with it. On the other hand, when asked if they thought a plastic note would have been better than a coin, 29 said yes. Most people seem to accept the need to replace the paper note, but not everyone thinks the coin is the best replacement.
